David Cameron is said to be so worried about the prospect of losing legislation in a parliamentary logjam that he held a series of meetings with MPs and peers last week described as a "charm offensive". The Prime Minister is definitely in listening mode as never before, said one Conservative David Cameron . "He is much more conciliatory, the mood music has completely changed." It is understood Mr Andy Coulson first informed the Prime Minister of his intention to leave last Wednesday before
